standard_metadata.standard_description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = l w h and V = b h to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Volume by multiplying area of base times height

question.content: **What is the volume of the following rectangular prism?**     Volume $=$  units$^3$

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The front face is shaded and has an area of 7 and 1 third square units.  The length of each edge perpendicular to the front face is 2 units.

hints.content: The volume of a rectangular prism can be found by multiplying the area of a base by the corresponding height.  $\text{Volume }= \greenD{\text{area of base}}\times \blueD{\text { height}}$
On the prism shown, we see a base with an area of $\greenD{7\dfrac13}$ square units.  The corresponding height has a length of $\blueD2$ units.
$\begin{align} \text{Volume }&= \greenD{7\dfrac13}\times \blueD{2} \\\\   \text{Volume }&= 14\dfrac23 \text{ units}^3 \end{align}$

question.content: **What is the volume of the following rectangular prism?**     Volume $=$  units$^3$

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The front face is shaded and has an area of 27 fifths square units.  The length of each edge perpendicular to the front face is 5 halves units.

hints.content: The volume of a rectangular prism can be found by multiplying the area of a base by the corresponding height.  $\text{Volume }= \greenD{\text{area of base}}\times \blueD{\text { height}}$
On the prism shown, we see a base with an area of $\greenD{\dfrac{27}{5}}$ square units.    The corresponding height has a length of $\blueD{\dfrac52}$ units.
$\begin{align} \text{Volume }&= \greenD{\dfrac{27}{5}}\times \blueD{\dfrac52} \\\\   \text{Volume }&= 13\dfrac12 \text{ units}^3 \end{align}$

question.content: **What is the volume of the following rectangular prism?**     Volume $=$  units$^3$

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The front face is shaded and has an area of 21 halves square units.  The length of each edge perpendicular to the front face is 8 thirds units.

hints.content: The volume of a rectangular prism can be found by multiplying the area of a base by the corresponding height.  $\text{Volume }= \greenD{\text{area of base}}\times \blueD{\text { height}}$
On the prism shown, we see a base with an area of $\greenD{\dfrac{21}{2}}$ square units.   The corresponding height has a length of $\blueD{\dfrac83}$ units.
$\begin{align} \text{Volume }&= \greenD{\dfrac{21}{2}}\times \blueD{\dfrac83} \\\\   \text{Volume }&= 28 \text{ units}^3 \end{align}$

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The top face is shaded and has an area of 16 and 1 fourths square units.  The length of each edge perpendicular to the top face is 1 half unit.

hints.content: The volume of a rectangular prism can be found by multiplying the area of a base by the corresponding height.  $\text{Volume }= \greenD{\text{area of base}}\times \blueD{\text { height}}$
On the prism shown, we see a base with an area of $\greenD{16\dfrac14}$ square units.    The corresponding height has a length of $\blueD{\dfrac12}$ unit.
$\begin{align} \text{Volume }&= \greenD{16\dfrac14}\times \blueD{\dfrac12} \\\\   \text{Volume }&= 8\dfrac18 \text{ units}^3 \end{align}$

question.content: **What is the volume of the following rectangular prism?**     Volume $=$  units$^3$

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The top face is shaded and has an area of 9 square units.  The length of each edge perpendicular to the top face is 3 and 2 thirds units.

hints.content: The volume of a rectangular prism can be found by multiplying the area of a base by the corresponding height.  $\text{Volume }= \greenD{\text{area of base}}\times \blueD{\text { height}}$
On the prism shown, we see a base with an area of $\greenD9$ square units.   The corresponding height has a length of $\blueD{3\dfrac23}$ unit.
$\begin{align} \text{Volume }&= \greenD9\times \blueD{3\dfrac23} \\\\   \text{Volume }&= 33 \text{ units}^3 \end{align}$

question.content: **What is the volume of the following rectangular prism?**     Volume $=$  units$^3$

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The right face is shaded and has an area of 23 fourths square units. The length of each edge perpendicular to the right face is 4 thirds units.

hints.content: The volume of a rectangular prism can be found by multiplying the area of a base by the corresponding height.  $\text{Volume }= \greenD{\text{area of base}}\times \blueD{\text { height}}$
On the prism shown, we see a base with an area of $\greenD{\dfrac{23}{4}}$ square units.    The corresponding height has a length of $\blueD{\dfrac43}$ units.
$\begin{align} \text{Volume }&= \greenD{\dfrac{23}{4}}\times \blueD{\dfrac43} \\\\   \text{Volume }&= 7\dfrac23 \text{ units}^3 \end{align}$

hints.content: The volume of a rectangular prism can be found by multiplying the area of a base by the corresponding height.  $\text{Volume }= \greenD{\text{area of base}}\times \blueD{\text { height}}$
On the prism shown, we see a base with an area of $\greenD{3\dfrac13}$ square units.      The corresponding height has a length of $\blueD{1\dfrac25}$ units.

question.content: **What is the volume of the following rectangular prism?**     Volume $=$  units$^3$

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The back face is shaded and has an area of 3 over 20 square units. The length of each edge perpendicular to the back face is 2 thirds unit.

hints.content: The volume of a rectangular prism can be found by multiplying the area of a base by the corresponding height.  $\text{Volume }= \greenD{\text{area of base}}\times \blueD{\text { height}}$
On the prism shown, we see a base with an area of $\greenD{\dfrac{3}{20}}$ square units.      The corresponding height has a length of $\blueD{\dfrac23}$ units.
$\begin{align} \text{Volume }&= \greenD{\dfrac{3}{20}}\times \blueD{\dfrac23} \\\\   \text{Volume }&= \dfrac{1}{10} \text{ units}^3 \end{align}$

question.content: **What is the volume of the following rectangular prism?**     Volume $=$  units$^3$

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The back face is shaded and has an area of 25 fourths square units. The length of each edge perpendicular to the back face is 8 fifths units.

hints.content: The volume of a rectangular prism can be found by multiplying the area of a base by the corresponding height.  $\text{Volume }= \greenD{\text{area of base}}\times \blueD{\text { height}}$
On the prism shown, we see a base with an area of $\greenD{\dfrac{25}{4}}$ square units.     The corresponding height has a length of $\blueD{\dfrac85}$ units.
$\begin{align} \text{Volume }&= \greenD{\dfrac{25}{4}}\times \blueD{\dfrac85} \\\\   \text{Volume }&= 10 \text{ units}^3 \end{align}$
